alert.note: Alert for Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine; Cascade County below 5000ft; Southern High Plains; Western and Central Chouteau County (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 14 at 8:11PM MDT until March 16 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Bears Paw Mountains and Southern Blaine, Cascade County below 5000ft, Southern High Plains and Western and Central Chouteau County. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the Wednesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest period of snow is expected to be late tonight into Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
